channel.title: [WIP] Claes Oldenburg Model
channel.description:
Doing this for an art class. Really need some critique/helpful suggestions.
I modeled the tube from a cylinder and the contents with a bezier spline.
I'm just kinda having trouble getting the splines smooth like the real one.
Here's the real one [url=http://www.art-edition.de/tmpimg/aidsolden.jpg]http://www.art-edition.de/tmpimg/aidsolden.jpg[/url]
I can barely find ANY pictures on google, the peice is called Tube Supported By Its Contents.
Here's mine so far. Sorry for it being blown out. I had to up the light to show more detail on it.
[img]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/4251/claeson3.jpg[/img] [img]http://img45.imageshack.us/img45/5633/claes2xg7.jpg[/img]

item.title: [WIP] Claes Oldenburg Model
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Yeah true about the shadows.

I need to do some serious material revamping. I got another chance to look at the magazine with the actual picture in it, and I noticed a lot wrong with my materials since it was a much bigger picture.

I’m gonna try to scan it sooner or later, but the red and white aren’t that reflective. They’re reflective in a weird way, sort of aniostrophy.

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Claes Oldenburg Model
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Bang Train, post:46, topic:156500”]STH: is it metal or plastic, cuz that makes a big difference.

if you want metal (like polished metal) the HDR needs to show a lot more
the bottom left is a good shade of red

the whites are both pretty bad
the left one has too much specular and not enough reflection (try to make the reflection the same for red and white, should probably try to keep the specular the same too)

my advice: look into how to make a good car paint. car paints are great for objects made out of metal and painted to be glossy (like a car)[/quote]

I guess it’s kinda like car paint, but it’s not really. The whole thing is made of bronze, but it is painted over but not like a car is. It’s really weird.

I know all about all that stuff though. The difference in the renderer I’m using and others is that I’m aiming for realism. I’m trying to physically recreate the material, not fake it like others.

I actually have another test going with some carpaint type materials I made a while ago.

I think that bottom left one is the original from earlier.

Another thing, I’ve compared my materials to my older ones and some high quality ones, and there’s almost no difference. We both approached it in the same way, and got the same results. The only real difference is a little color difference and glossiness.[br][size=1]Posted on: November 08, 2007, 06:53:56 PM[/size][hr]Update.

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Claes Oldenburg Model
item.dc:creator: @Bang_Train Bang Train
item.description:
@Bang_Train wrote:

STH: is it metal or plastic, cuz that makes a big difference.

if you want metal (like polished metal) the HDR needs to show a lot more
the bottom left is a good shade of red

the whites are both pretty bad
the left one has too much specular and not enough reflection (try to make the reflection the same for red and white, should probably try to keep the specular the same too)

my advice: look into how to make a good car paint. car paints are great for objects made out of metal and painted to be glossy (like a car)

Read full topic

item.title: [WIP] Claes Oldenburg Model
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

exe626:

The problem, STH, is that it sits floating on top of the grass pieces. When a weighted item sits on grass, it sinks into it, with grass coving some parts of the outside of the base. Thats a way you could fix it.

That comes in later, when the final image is composed together because that’s harder.

Yeah, I’m basically doing a material test scene this time, trying different materials next to each other to see which ones work better.

Read full topic

There’s like one photo of it, and the view doesn’t really help with that. So I’m going to have some creative freedom with it.

item.title: [WIP] Claes Oldenburg Model
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I didn’t only use C4D for this one. I only modeled everything in that. And I don’t only use that either, I have a shitload of other things I use.

And what skill is there in using material packs? Unless they’re something like tile or wood textures, I don’t use them.

But yeah. Update. Testing some more things, I think it’s looking better. I think the main thing taking away from realism right now is scale.

Sorry about the background too if there’s any errors with it. I took a suggestion and tried the burn tool, and also a tiny bit of the blur tool.

Read full topic
